node_2: national film award for best film on family welfare
edge: Taare Zameen Par won the National Film Award for Best Film on Family Welfare in 2008.

node_2: filmfare award for best film for 2008
edge: Taare Zameen Par won the Filmfare Award for Best Film for 2008.
Khan's directorial role in Taare Zameen Par was recognized at the 2008 Zee Cine Awards.
Safary's performance in Taare Zameen Par was recognized at the 2008 Zee Cine Awards.

node_2: official entry for the 2009 academy awards best foreign film
edge: Taare Zameen Par was initially acclaimed as India's official entry for the 2009 Academy Awards Best Foreign Film.

node_2: academy of motion picture arts and sciences
edge: Three days before Chandni Chowk to China hit theaters in the U.S. And India, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences announced its shortlist of nine films edging closer to a foreign-language nomination. India's submission, the powerful and moving Taare Zameen Par by Aamir Khan, didn't make the cut. This indicates that Taare Zameen Par was considered for nomination by the Academy but wasn't shortlisted.

Sadly, that film never will be seen by mainstream American audiences; yet Chandni Chowk is enjoying a hefty publicity push. This suggests that while Taare Zameen Par may not have been widely recognized in the U.S., another Indian movie, Chandni Chowk, is receiving more attention.
The film Taare Zameen Par was not included in the Academy Award shortlist.
Khan claimed that he was 'not surprised' that Taare Zameen Par was not included in the Academy Award shortlist.
The audiences, for which Khan has made the film, really loved it and the audiences outside India have also loved it.
American film critic Lisa Tsering commented on Taare Zameen Par in The Hollywood Reporter.
The Indian news media frequently compared Taare Zameen Par's nomination failure with the British drama film Slumdog Millionaire's multiple Academy Award nominations and wins.

node_2: comparison between taare zameen par and slumdog millionaire
edge: Film critic Rajeev Masand argued that it is difficult to compare the two films.

node_2: comparison between taare zameen par and slumdog millionaire
edge: Slumdog Millionaire actor Mahesh Manjrekar stated that 'Indian movies are underestimated' there.

node_2: comparison between taare zameen par and slumdog millionaire
edge: Slumdog Millionaire director Danny Boyle was being recognized with multiple Academy Award nominations and wins.

node_2: multiple academy award nominations and wins
edge: Slumdog Millionaire received multiple Academy Award nominations and wins, while Taare Zameen Par did not make it to the final round of the Oscars.
